''Hokkaido Air System''. Retrieved on August 30, 2011. "〒007-0880　札幌市東区丘珠町 丘珠空港内"</ref> It operates scheduled domestic services in [[Hokkaidō]].<ref name="FI">{{cite news | title= Directory: World Airlines | work= [[Flight International]] | page= 91 | date= 2007-04-03}}</ref> Its main base of operations is Okadama Airport.<ref name="HQ"/> == History == The airline was established in 1997 and started operations in 1998. Founded as a joint venture, it was an affiliate of [[Japan Air System]] until that airline consolidated into [[Japan Airlines]].<ref>"[http://www.jal.com/en/ir/finance/pdf/line/b020930.pdf 2002/11/15 Interim Financial Information]." ''[[Japan Airlines]]''.</ref> Hokkaido Air System is owned by [[Japan Airlines|Japan Airlines Domestic]] (51%) and Hokkaidō regional government (49%).<ref name="FI"/> [[Air Hokkaido]] ceased operations on 31 March 2006 and its sole route, [[Hakodate]]-[[Okushiri, Hokkaido|Okushiri]], was taken over the next day by Hokkaido Air System.<ref>{{cite news | title= Directory: World Airlines | work= [[Flight International]] | page= 57 | date= 2007-03-27}}</ref> Previously the headquarters were in the Terminal Building of [[New Chitose Airport]] in [[Chitose, Hokkaidō]], [[Japan]].<ref name="OldHQ">"[http://web.archive.org/web/20090321205207/http://www.hac-air.co.jp/about.html 会社概要]."
